meanings.definition: The main axis or stem of a feather.
meanings.sent1: The rhachides of the feather provides structure and support.
meanings.sent2: Birds use their rhachides to control the direction of flight.
meanings.sent3: The rhachides of the feather decided to take a break and relax.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as the rhachides of a feather.
meanings.sent5: The rhachides of the feather stood out against the blue sky.

meanings.definition: The central axis of a spikelet in grasses.
meanings.sent1: The rhachides of the grass spikelet holds the seeds together.
meanings.sent2: Farmers study the rhachides of grasses to improve crop yield.
meanings.sent3: The rhachides of the grass spikelet told a joke to the seeds.
meanings.sent4: The rhachides of the grass spikelet intertwined like a dance.
meanings.sent5: The rhachides of the grass spikelet glistened in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The central axis of a pinnate leaf.
meanings.sent1: The rhachides of the pinnate leaf supports the leaflets.
meanings.sent2: Botanists examine the rhachides of pinnate leaves for research.
meanings.sent3: The rhachides of the pinnate leaf went on a rollercoaster ride.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas branched out like the rhachides of a pinnate leaf.
meanings.sent5: The rhachides of the pinnate leaf swayed gently in the breeze.
